description:
Yuta Okkotsu is a nervous high school student who is suffering from a serious problem—his childhood friend Rika has turned into a curse and won't leave him alone. Since Rika is no ordinary curse, his plight is noticed by Satoru Gojo, a teacher at Jujutsu High, a school where fledgling exorcists learn how to combat curses. Gojo convinces Yuta to enroll, but can he learn enough in time to confront the curse that haunts him?

(Source: Viz Media)
synonyms: มหาเวทย์ผนึกมาร : ซีโร่

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Vore
tags.description: Features a character being swallowed or swallowing another creature whole.

title.native: 呪術廻戦 0 東京都立呪術高等専門学校

node.description: Creator of [Jujutsu Kaisen](https://anilist.co/manga/101517/Jujutsu-Kaisen/) and former assistant of [Yasuhiro Kano](https://anilist.co/staff/96908/Yasuhiro-Kano).
Director currently affiliated with [E&H Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/7229/EH-Productions).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/156204341) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hiramatz/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tadashi-hiramatz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@hiramatz1963)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).

Aspired to become an animator when he saw [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/), while in elementary school. He studied art in middle school and high school, and later enrolled to a university with an animation department. There he was set on either moving to the United States or Japan to study abroad, and ended up choosing Japan due to how popular hand-drawn animation was there. After moving to Japan and graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology and Arts, he joined [Studio Comet](https://anilist.co/studio/126/) in 2005 and began his career in the industry.

He later joined [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) after getting scouted out by the studio's founder, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/).

Debuted as a director in 2017 with [Garo: Vanishing Line](https://anilist.co/anime/99796/).

In March 2021 he established the [E&H Production](https://anilist.co/studio/7229) studio becoming its Representative.
Hiroshi Seko is a screenwriter.
Animation Producer and Executive Officer at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).
Director and General Manager of CGI Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). He's also a Board Member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YoshimasaTerui)__

__Yoshimasa Terui__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and guitarist. He composed music for the idol unit [Sora Tob Sakana](https://anilist.co/staff/126806/Sora-Tob-Sakana) and is a member of the math-rock band Haisuinonasa.

[Twitter (Alisa Okehazama)](https://twitter.com/aliiisa_ok) | [Twitter (Alisa Fukami)](https://twitter.com/alisa_024) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E6%A1%B6%E7%8B%AD%E9%96%93%E3%81%82%E3%82%8A%E3%81%95-100315608634523/) | [SoundCloud (Alisa Fukami)](https://soundcloud.com/alisafukami) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6VMGyvtQPQ1uPvkaSm73aR?si=NT2wdnG2Sy60driRfdIQdw) | [AppleMusic](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/alisa-okehazama/1548614368) | [Blog](https://profiee.com/i/alisa_oke) | [Weibo](http://weibo.com/okehazama)

Alisa Okehazama, alternatively known as Alisa Fukami is a Japanese composer and arranger
[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/hiroakitsutsumi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroaki850605)

[Website](https://www.tateki.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TatekiKobayashi)

Tateki Kobayashi is a singer-songwriter, lyricist, composer, and music producer. Graduated from Kindai University.
Color designer currently affiliated with [E&H Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/7229/EH-Productions).
Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東潤一)

Founder and representative director of Studio Easter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hieimarumaru)

An anime photography director affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/keisukeyanagi01)__

__Keisuke Yanagi__ is a Japanese editor.

[Website](http://kinggnu.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kinggnu_jp)

King Gnu is a japanese band formed in 2015. The band was originally called Srv.Vinci, but renamed to King Gnu in 2017. They made their major debut in 2019 under Ariola Japan with the album "Sympa."

**Members:**
- [Daiki Tsuneta](https://anilist.co/staff/158731) (Vo., Gt.)
- Yuu Seki (Dr., Sampler)
- [Kazuki Arai](https://anilist.co/staff/183237) (Ba., Bass synthetizer)
- Satoru Iguchi (Vo., Keyboard)
__Keiji Oota__ is a Japanese producer and animation planner. Managing Director at Toho.

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
__Yoshihisa Heishi__ is a Japanese magazine editor, animation planner and producer. He currently works for Shueisha and was an editor-in-chief for Weekly Shounen Jump between 2011-2017.
